19 #ifndef PLATCOMMONOKTOINCLUDE

27 // Many of the common definitions must be explicitly enabled by the
28 // particular PLATFORM_HEADER being used
30 
31 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
32 
33 // The XAP2b compiler uses these macros to enable and disable placement
34 // in zero-page memory. All other platforms do not have zero-page memory
35 // so these macros define to nothing.
36 #ifndef _HAL_USING_XAP2B_PRAGMAS_
37  #define XAP2B_PAGEZERO_ON
38  #define XAP2B_PAGEZERO_OFF
39 #endif
40 
41 #endif //DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS

163  #define MEMSET(d, v, l) halCommonMemSet(d, v, l)
164  #define MEMCOPY(d, s, l) halCommonMemMove(d, s, l)
165  #define MEMMOVE(d, s, l) halCommonMemMove(d, s, l)
166  #define MEMPGMCOPY(d, s, l) halCommonMemPGMCopy(d, s, l)
167  #define MEMCOMPARE(s0, s1, l) halCommonMemCompare(s0, s1, l)
168  #define MEMPGMCOMPARE(s0, s1, l) halCommonMemPGMCompare(s0, s1, l)
169 
171 #else
172 
176  #define MEMSET(d, v, l) memset(d, v, l)
177  #define MEMCOPY(d, s, l) memcpy(d, s, l)
178  #define MEMMOVE(d, s, l) memmove(d, s, l)
179  #define MEMPGMCOPY(d, s, l) memcpy(d, s, l)
180  #define MEMCOMPARE(s0, s1, l) memcmp(s0, s1, l)
181  #define MEMPGMCOMPARE(s0, s1, l) memcmp(s0, s1, l)
182 #endif //_HAL_USE_COMMON_MEMUTILS_

223 #define BIT(x) (1U << (x)) // Unsigned avoids compiler warnings re BIT(15)
224 
228 #define BIT32(x) (((uint32_t) 1) << (x))
229 
235 #define SETBIT(reg, bit) (reg) |= BIT(bit)
236 
242 #define SETBITS(reg, bits) (reg) |= (bits)
243 
249 #define CLEARBIT(reg, bit) (reg) &= ~(BIT(bit))
250 
256 #define CLEARBITS(reg, bits) (reg) &= ~(bits)
257 
261 #define READBIT(reg, bit) ((reg) & (BIT(bit)))
262 
267 #define READBITS(reg, bits) ((reg) & (bits))
268 
270 
272 
277 
281 #define LOW_BYTE(n) ((uint8_t)((n) & 0xFF))
282 
286 #define HIGH_BYTE(n) ((uint8_t)(LOW_BYTE((n) >> 8)))
287 
292 #define HIGH_LOW_TO_INT(high, low) ( \
293  ((uint16_t) (((uint16_t) (high)) << 8)) \
294  + ((uint16_t) ((low) & 0xFF)) \
295  )
296 
300 #define INT8U_TO_INT32U(byte3, byte2, byte1, byte0) ( \
301  (((uint32_t) (byte3)) << 24) \
302  + (((uint32_t) (byte2)) << 16) \
303  + (((uint32_t) (byte1)) << 8) \
304  + ((uint32_t) ((byte0) & 0xFF)) \
305  )
306 
310 #define BYTE_0(n) ((uint8_t)((n) & 0xFF))
311 
315 #define BYTE_1(n) ((uint8_t)(BYTE_0((n) >> 8)))
316 
320 #define BYTE_2(n) ((uint8_t)(BYTE_0((n) >> 16)))
321 
325 #define BYTE_3(n) ((uint8_t)(BYTE_0((n) >> 24)))
326 
330 #define COUNTOF(a) (sizeof(a) / sizeof(a[0]))

340 
345 #define elapsedTimeInt8u(oldTime, newTime) \
346  ((uint8_t) ((uint8_t)(newTime) - (uint8_t)(oldTime)))
347 
352 #define elapsedTimeInt16u(oldTime, newTime) \
353  ((uint16_t) ((uint16_t)(newTime) - (uint16_t)(oldTime)))
354 
359 #define elapsedTimeInt32u(oldTime, newTime) \
360  ((uint32_t) ((uint32_t)(newTime) - (uint32_t)(oldTime)))
361 
366 #define MAX_INT8U_VALUE (0xFF)
367 #define HALF_MAX_INT8U_VALUE (0x80)
368 #define timeGTorEqualInt8u(t1, t2) \
369  (elapsedTimeInt8u(t2, t1) <= (HALF_MAX_INT8U_VALUE))
370 
375 #define MAX_INT16U_VALUE (0xFFFF)
376 #define HALF_MAX_INT16U_VALUE (0x8000)
377 #define timeGTorEqualInt16u(t1, t2) \
378  (elapsedTimeInt16u(t2, t1) <= (HALF_MAX_INT16U_VALUE))
379 
384 #define MAX_INT32U_VALUE (0xFFFFFFFFL)
385 #define HALF_MAX_INT32U_VALUE (0x80000000L)
386 #define timeGTorEqualInt32u(t1, t2) \
387  (elapsedTimeInt32u(t2, t1) <= (HALF_MAX_INT32U_VALUE))
388

398 #ifndef UNUSED_VAR
399 
404 #define UNUSED_VAR(x) (void)(x)
405 #endif
406 
407 #ifdef DEBUG_OFF
408 // On March 17, 2014, DEBUG_OFF was deprecated and replaced by DEBUG_STRIPPED.
409 // Some builds still attempt to use DEBUG_OFF and as a result there are
410 // failures. On 2016-10-04 implemented a little bandaid here to define
411 // DEBUG_STRIPPED when debugging is meant to be "off".
412  #define DEBUG_STRIPPED
413 #endif
414 
418 #ifndef DEBUG_LEVEL
419  #if defined(DEBUG) && defined(DEBUG_STRIPPED)
420  #error "DEBUG and DEBUG_OFF cannot be both be defined!"
421  #elif defined(DEBUG)
422  #define DEBUG_LEVEL FULL_DEBUG
423  #elif defined(DEBUG_STRIPPED)
424  #define DEBUG_LEVEL NO_DEBUG
425  #else
426  #define DEBUG_LEVEL BASIC_DEBUG
427  #endif
428 #endif
429 
433 #ifndef STATIC_ASSERT
434  #define STATIC_ASSERT(__condition, __errorstr)
435 #endif
